document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the Middle American leaf-litter inhabiting weevil genus Theognete Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae; Molytinae; Lymantini) 2458

subSubSection.paragraph:
85.
Theognete hesmos Anderson
, new species
( Figures 16 , 24 , 288 , 298 , 307 , 328–331 )

Diagnosis. Size. Length, male, 3.06–3.65mm ; female, 2.84–3.91mm . Width, male, 1.69–1.97mm ; female, 1.57–2.14mm . Pronotum strongly cordate, punctures large and deep, some specimens with irregular, weak, median ridge; scales simple, short, appressed to suberect. Procoxae moderately separated. Prosternum with subapical constriction with very large, deep punctures. Elytra with scales short, simple, suberect and recurved,

not plumose; posterolateral region with series of three large punctures. Ventrite 5 with punctures moderately large, towards apex in middle confluent and appearing as transverse impression. Metasternum with lateral punctures behind metacoxae very small and shallow. Aedeagus as in Fig. 298 .
Natural history . Collected from berlese extraction of cloud forest leaf litter at elevations from 1475– 1825m .

Derivation of specific name . Noun in apposition: named from the Greek
hesmos
, meaning swarm or flock, in reference to the great abundance of this species in samples from near Tlanchinol.

Material examined .
157♂ , 123♀♀ ( BMNH , CMNC , CWOB , ECOS , MCZC , MZLU , UAQM , USNM )
.
